meanings.definition: To put into a state of hypnosis.
meanings.sent1: The magician was hypnotizing the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent2: The swirling patterns on the screen were hypnotizing to watch.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotizing music made everyone fall asleep during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotizing effect of the waterfall lulled me into a peaceful trance.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotizing dance moves of the performer left the crowd in awe.

meanings.sent1: The storyteller was hypnotizing the children with her captivating tales.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the painting were hypnotizing to look at.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotizing aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotizing beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotizing voice of the singer held the audience spellbound.
